prompt: You need to generate an input prompt for a text-to-image neural network. The system accepts as correct the query string, where all arguments are separated by commas.The words in prompt are crucial. Users need to prompt what they want to see, specifying artist names, media sources, or art styles to get desired results. Be descriptive in a manne similar to prompts provided below about what you want. It is more sensitive to precise wording. That includes adjectives and prepositions like ‚Äúin front of [x]‚Äú, and ‚Äútaken by [camera name]‚Äú.It also supports weights. By bracketing the words you can change their importance. For example, (rainy) would be twice as important compared to rainy" for the model
column3: and [rainy] would be half as important. Write a medium lenth prompt
column4: like below. Too long and it would fail to generate
column5: too short and it would generate crap. Be as detailed as possible and avoid both scenarios at any cost.As photographers and painters know
column6: light has a huge effect on the final impression an image creates. Specify lighting conditions. Describe the type of light you want to see and the time of day it is. You don‚Äôt need complex vocabulary. The MOST IMPORTANT thing is that a text-to-image neural network interprets the prompt from up to down
